Hello,
I'm a Ph.D student at Wright State Univeristy and I'm trying to find 
the equilibrium composition of an air mixture for high temperature 
(up to 20,000 K).  I found the necessary thermo data to create the 
input .cti files from the NASA Glenn website and i verified that the 
program was reading the thermo data propertly by matching the thermo 
properties to tabulated thermo data.  The code runs fine from 300-
10000 K then I get an error message for any temperature greater than 
10,000 K.

??? Error using ==> thermophase/equilibrate

Procedure: equilibrate
Error:   no convergence in 1000iterations.

Error in ==> C:\MATLAB6p5\work\PlasmaEquilWAr.m
On line 36  ==>  equilibrate(HiTempAir,'TP')

The temperature ranges that i use are 300-1000 K, 1000-6000 K, and 
6000-20,000 K, so the problem is not a transition from one 
temperature range to another.  Some of the thermo properities for 
high temperature air have a peak near 10,000 K and this may be 
causing a problem with the minimazation of the Gibbs free energy to 
find the equilibrium composition.  Or it could be that more 
iterations need to be taken to acieve conergence.  I cannot find a 
command in MATLAB to alter the convergence critera and I'm not sure 
of how to do this with the C++ source code.  Another problem i'm 
having is find all the C++ source code for Cantera and linking to 
the header files.  Any help would be greatly apprecieated.

Thank You,
Sean Henderson
